value: well shabbat shalom this is episode 25
and my shabbat shalom sabbath podcast my
name is Daniel John Lee and I am making
a podcast for Torah restoration
ministries the website is WWF it and
Torah comm and today I am going to do a
podcast called on head coverings in
which we will examine what the
scriptures say about men and women
wearing head coverings as you can see I
just got a linen 100% linen head
covering that I ordered from the poorest
thimble which is a link that you can
find on my website under under links mmm
she she makes all sorts of clothing for
Messianics
with her husband and she provides a lot
of different types of garments zzs head
coverings turbans things like that and I
ordered this one I needed to get a new
head covering and just just got here in
the mail so since I just got my new head
covering I thought it would be good to
make a podcast about it so if we look at
the Torah just kind of examining the
Tanakh we see that the Levitical priests
the Levites wore a head covering in the
King James Bible actually described as a
turban these head coverings like this
one were made of a hundred percent linen
that was very specific from Yahweh that
the the head coverings the turbans that
the high priests and the priest would
wear would be made of 100% linens and of
course they always had their head
covered when they would go into the
tabernacle or the temple and perform
their priestly duties so we can see even
from the earliest times that that those
who are called to be priests covered
their heads now if we skip forward to oh
and also another thing to look at in the
Tanakh is that the Kings of course would
wear head coverings because they would
wear crowns so both kings and priests
wore head coverings the priests were
commanded to wear head coverings a
turban a linen turban and Kings would
often wear crowns as a sign of their
authority
skipping forward to the Brit hadashah
the renewed covenant we see that Yahshua
refers to his people as kings and
priests this is something that we are
right now
and something we will of course become
more of when we're resurrected and we
live with him for eternity but we are
called to be kings and priests
so if Yahshua calls us to be kings and
priests it makes sense that if we are to
be kings and priests that we should
behave like kings and priests and it's
very clear in the Torah and in the
Tanakh that kings and priests wore head
coverings now if you turn your Bibles to
first Corinthians chapter 11 and you
read particularly the first half of the
chapter you will find an interesting
passage where Paul talks about head
coverings now people have misinterpreted
this scripture as trying to suggest that
Paul is telling men not to wear head
coverings but women should wear head
coverings but if you actually examined
the Greek that's being used there what
Paul is saying is he's urging men not to
wear head coverings that flow down over
whereas women are to wear head coverings
that flow down over over in other words
a problem that was happening in corinth
is some of the men were behaving
effeminately and they were wearing
female long flowing head coverings and
Paul told those men to stop wearing that
which pertains to a woman which is a
violation of Torah and two instead and
and to instead have women to wear the
long flowing head coverings but not men
he was not telling men to just stop
wearing head coverings altogether
because if he were to do that he would
be opposing Torah because if it's wrong
for a man to cover his head when in the
presence of Yahweh then it would have
been wrong for all the Levitical priests
who covered their heads when they were
doing their priestly duty but that
doesn't make any sense because that's
what Torah tells you to do and then it
goes on further to talk about the
advantages to having a head covering why
a head covering is in place it talks
about how when women cover their hairs
they have power over the angels
it provides them with demonic protection
from the influences of deception that
women in particular are especially prone
to and so it's very very important that
that women wear their head coverings but
also men are to wear their head
coverings too you know the scripture is
about modesty are not just for women men
are to be modest as well and a head
covering is a sign of modesty but it's
also a sign and more importantly a sign
of submission to Yahweh when we cover
our heads we show that we are submitted
to him it's an act of reverence that we
that we partake in his sight and of
course we're supposed to cover our heads
according to what Paul says we're
supposed to cover our heads when we're
praying and prophesying but you can also
look at the other scriptures and see
that we're supposed to pray without
ceasing or we're supposed to always be
in an attitude of Prayer so if we're
supposed to pray without ceasing and
always be in an attitude of prayer then
it makes sense that we should always
cover our heads now obviously you know
if you go to bed or take a shower then
you don't need to cover your head but
you know as much as possible during the
waking hours I think it's good to cover
your head if you're intending to talk to
Yahweh throughout your day which is a
good habit to foster now it's also
important that if you get a head
covering you should get one that is a
hundred percent linen because that is
the requirement for head coverings that
we see in the Torah when Yahweh told the
Levite priest to wear head coverings he
made sure to tell them that it was to be
made of 100% linen so we should do the
same you can find a hundred percent
linen turbans or head coverings anywhere
I myself don't like to wear the skull
cap or the kippah that's traditional to
be worn by Jewish men and women because
the skull cap actually has somewhat
pagan origins it looks very similar to
the hat that the Roman Catholic Pope
wears and other other bishops wear in
the Roman Catholic Church and I've done
some research and found that the skull
cap was actually seems to have some
pagan origins in terms of generating the
Sun God so I don't like to wear the the
skull cap instead I like to wear more of
the
non-traditional head covering if you
will this one is sort of a turban as you
can see it just sort of fits over the
head but it's very nice it has a nice
little headband and it's made of a
hundred percent linen and it's very
comfortable and kind of modulates the
your personal weather I guess and it's
very nice I just I just got this one and
so I'm just sort of still learning how
to wear it but but I like it
so I like to wear this more traditional
you often will also see some men and and
Jews and Messianics who wear the one of
the Sephardic style which is more of
like a cap I used to have one that that
looked just like that one but it was
cotton and I wanted to make sure I got
one that was that was linen so wearing a
head covering is very very important I
think it's important spiritually it's
important and as a sign of submission to
Yahweh it's important to identify
yourself as a priest and as a king to
take your head covering off or to bear
your head is a sign of disrespect it's a
sign of non submission to Yahweh it's a
sign of sort of you know something
negative or or bad happening there's
also other reasons for our head covering
as well you can read in the books of I
believe it's second Samuel where David
covers his head when he's mourning and
he's in a time of deep mourning he's
weeping over some things that are
happening and so he covers his head as a
sign of mourning and that is a that is a
definite definite reasons to to cover
your head but keep in mind David often
would have his head covered even when he
was not mourning because he would wear a
crown he was a king after all so it's
important to realize that but I think
it's it's very important to wear the set
covering read first Corinthians 11
because Apostle Paul gives many reasons
why a head covering is important he
gives his opinion or Midrash on why the
Torah requires those who are at least
doing priestly service and work to wear
a head covering again since we are all
called to be priests and kings I think
it's important that we all wear a head
covering so we're in the head covering
along with wearing the ZZ and I think
are both two important things that I
think protect you spiritually and I
think that these things protect you
spiritually probably in ways that we
don't even understand or know that only
Yahweh knows but you know a lot of times
Yahweh just asked us to obey he tells us
what to do and he expects us to obey and
he may not explain everything about how
things protect us or bless us but they
do and I can tell you from personal
experience that wearing the head
covering is a is a blessing it reminds
me to be in constant communion and
contact with Yahweh and it's also a
great witnessing tool as well because
people ask about it say hey what's
what's that hat about and why do you
wear those funny-looking strings that
come out from underneath your shirt what
is that all about and so it's a great
way to begin witnessing and talking to
people about Torah and about Yahshua so
I hope this podcast ministered to you
and I encourage you to go out and get
yourself 100% linen head covering
shabbat shalom
